result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Lee Jackson III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Supervision through the Mental Health Unit of the department.

miscConds.notes:
Pay applicable costs, surcharges and assessments over period of probation.  Upon successful completion of revocation, any balance remaining unpaid is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant.

Provide DNA sample, surcharge waived as the Court finds an inability to pay.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restriction:  firearm possession; voting.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
Not to possess weapons/firearms.
No drinking or drugs.
No contact with victim.

Coperate with the department.
Take prescribed medications.
Restitution set at zero.
Obtain AODA assessment.  Cooperate with any treatment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert Lee Jackson III

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Robert Lee Jackson in court with attorney Valeria L Taylor.  Defendant Robert Lee Jackson in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Count 1:  penalty enhancer dismissed.
Count 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
**********
Statements made as to sentencing.
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, with credit for 52 DAYS time served.  This sentence is STAYED and defendant placed on PROBATION for a period of 1 year with the following conditions:
Supervised through the Mental Health unit of the department
-Cooperate with the Department
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Possess no weapons / firearms
-Obtain AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment
-No drinking or drugs
-Take prescribed medications
-No contact with
-Restitution set at zero

The Court ordered the defendant to pay applicable costs, surcharges and assessments over period of probation.  Upon successful completion or revocation, any balance remaining unpaid is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant

The Court ordered the defendant to provide a DNA sample surcharge waived as the court finds an inability to pay

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting 
Filed,
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement (copy given to defendant);
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.  kmw

Attorney Valeria L Taylor in court, defendant Robert Lee Jackson not in court, in custody.  Lucy J Kronforst for Tyrone St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  On counsel request, plea/sent rescheduled.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Valeria L Taylor in court, defendant Robert Lee Jackson not in court, in custody.  Lucy J Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: DE competent to stand trial, suspension lifted

records.addlTxt: Peter G, Theodore C nor address.  kmw

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.   Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro Branch 34.   Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Bail argued and set.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 34.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.

Defendant Robert Lee Jackson in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Robert Lee Jackson in custody.  James Griffin for Tyrone Martin St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Doctor's report received and filed.  Parties reviewed report and do not contest findings.  Court found defendant competent to proceed and reinstated proceedings.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Based on the recent report, case calendared for early return on APRIL 3, 2014, 1:30pm.  kmw
dated 3/21/14 from Mendota requesting earlier hearing date.  kmw

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: Defendant Robert Lee Jackson in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Robert Lee Jackson in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties review the doctor's report.  State and Defense do not challenge the report.  The Court found defendant DOES LACK THE COMPACITY TO UNDERSTAND COURT PROCEEDINGS.  Court orders proceedings suspended.   Court ordered defendant committed to the Department of Health and Family Services for Institutional Care in order to restore competency within the statutory time frame.  The Court further found that the defendant is not competent to refuse medication for the mental condition.  Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department for transportation to the designated facility.  Order of Commitment signed and filed.  Court orders case adjourned for Return of Doctor's Report in br 34  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for May 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.
NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION TO REDUCE BAIL from Attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.

Defendant Robert Lee Jackson in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Robert Lee Jackson in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause, suspended proceedings and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for February 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
